messages: a5feb63b4be6660b52aba030b7de4da4 (21:37): Perhaps the wrong channel to ask, but‚Ä¶ :D What if any, framework, or CMS do you guys use for basic brochure type sites for your clients. Sites that are on a <40 hour budget?
a5feb63b4be6660b52aba030b7de4da4 (21:42): Guess I'm just not efficient enough with WP on a 40 hour budget :D unless I tweak a template instead of start from scratch.
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (21:52): a5feb63b4be6660b52aba030b7de4da4: wordpress is pretty much cheapiest you can show around the markets :)

a5feb63b4be6660b52aba030b7de4da4 (22:07): 0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf I used to use ModX until just very recently‚Ä¶ now I've actually started using PageLime, white labeled for myself. Thought about webPop because it shows promise‚Ä¶
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (22:07): prefers to stay away from anything PHP based
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (22:08): but on the other hand I am bored with CMS and service business

a5feb63b4be6660b52aba030b7de4da4 (22:09): I wish I was more familiar with Ruby, and new of a good Ruby on Rails CMS :D My new years resolution this year was to learn ROR‚Ä¶ Didn't happen‚Ä¶ or hasn't happened rather.
a5feb63b4be6660b52aba030b7de4da4 (22:09): :D
d9078dba28af90fd4ec00671a17e4575 (22:10): a5feb63b4be6660b52aba030b7de4da4 maybe this will help get you started: http://www.sitepoint.com/learn-ruby-on-rails/
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (22:10): a5feb63b4be6660b52aba030b7de4da4: RoR is so 2000.... we need to start look ahead for node.js CMS :)
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (22:10): if there ain't one yet :)

a5feb63b4be6660b52aba030b7de4da4 (22:12): Argh‚Ä¶ don't tell me that :D I can only choose one for now‚Ä¶ and I want it to be the right one this go around‚Ä¶ I spent 4 years in actionscript‚Ä¶ and feel today that it was 95% in vain.

a5feb63b4be6660b52aba030b7de4da4 (22:12): @digitalNative - Thanks! I actually have a Lynda account, and was going to try it, and maybe thinkvitamin. Already went through the original Rails for Zombies. Fun site.
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (22:13): a5feb63b4be6660b52aba030b7de4da4: look even more ahead.. Dash CSM!
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (22:13): CMS even
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (22:13): or whatever they are called tomorrow
d9078dba28af90fd4ec00671a17e4575 (22:13): Calipso is starting to grow‚Ä¶ I think its node.js based
d9078dba28af90fd4ec00671a17e4575 (22:13): I like codeIgniter & Drupal personally

a5feb63b4be6660b52aba030b7de4da4 (22:16): I've used codeigniter and EE a little bit‚Ä¶ Never got into Drupal though I've heard good things‚Ä¶ Main reason I never Drupaled was the Learning curve was huge, but once learnt very powerful...
d9078dba28af90fd4ec00671a17e4575 (22:16): It's not that bad if you have exp with CodeIgniter or EE.
d9078dba28af90fd4ec00671a17e4575 (22:17): But the Node.js direction seems to be the right one
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (22:38): hey all
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (22:38): in an interview, someone told me there was a reason to use hyphens instead of underscores in css classnames and ids...anyone know why?
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (22:39): I had always thought it was personal preference.
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (22:39): yeah
2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e (22:39): thats new to me
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (22:40): it had something to do with javascript i think.
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (22:40): not sure what it could be though.
2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e (22:40): i have no idea underscores suck
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (22:42): Free: HTML5 training offered by Microsoft
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (22:42): Isn't that like asking big tobacco for ways to quit smoking?
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (22:43): free training, I thought that's why they made w3schools
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (22:43): HTML5.NET
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (22:43): 0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf: that site rocks!
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (22:43): i like the doctype they use. xhtml 1.0 transitional.
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (22:44): it's actually something my friend bought from domain market few years ago
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (22:44): he kindly asked could I produce content there for free so that he could rip off all the ad money
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (22:44): that's nice of him.
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (22:47): eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18: obviously didn't happen
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (22:48): how much did he pay for the domain?
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (23:07): eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18: around 5kEUR I think
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (23:07): wtf
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (23:07): that's like 10,000 usd.
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (23:07): well, almost :)
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (23:08): if USD has diven deep recently
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (23:08): a few years ago.
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (23:09): it's worth of the money if you turn it something like w3school and generate 100k - 1M visits per month

c3b9faf5c1027a2c5f57ff67a9828f25 (23:24): Does Anyone have an opinion about grid systems in general or 960?
d9078dba28af90fd4ec00671a17e4575 (23:25): It's good are you doing rapid prototypes or an adaptive UI?

bac1ce548ca5670aad45c4cb8d55a02f (23:39): c3b9faf5c1027a2c5f57ff67a9828f25: I'm using css-grids especially for prototyping. if you consider designing for mobile it's hard to use 960.gs for instance because you often want to display the website other than you do on desktops of notebooks.
